info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 9:34AM CDT until July 28 at 7:37AM CDT by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant Hill MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas...
Big Creek at Blairstown affecting Johnson, Cass and Henry Counties.
Blackwater River near Blue Lick affecting Saline and Cooper Counties.
Stranger Creek at Easton affecting Atchison and Leavenworth Counties.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Blackwater River at Valley City affecting Johnson and Pettis Counties.
Crooked River near Richmond affecting Ray County.
Little Blue River near Lake City affecting Jackson County.
Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Stranger Creek at Easton.
* WHEN...Until Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water enters low-lying fields south of Easton. At 18.0 feet, 1st street in Easton and 231st street north and south of Easton begin to flood. At 19.5 feet, Highway 192 just east of Easton is closed due to swift current of water over the road. At 20.0 feet, All roads out of Easton except for highway 192 west of 231st street in Easton are closed. In addition, water covers Millwood Road, 3 miles north of Easton. Water depth is 6 inches across the eastbound lane. At 21.5 feet, Most of Easton east of 231st Street floods. A campground in Easton floods. Several homes experience water on the first floor. Water nearly surrounds but does not enter the former Easton grade school.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.5 feet this evening. It will then rise to 20.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall to 19.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise to 19.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING
